verses.text: You are sons of the LORD your God. You shall not cut yourselves or shave the front of your head for the dead.
verses.comment: The practices of cutting and shaving refer to pagan mourning customs forbidden to Israel.

verses.text: Because you are a holy people to the LORD your God, and the LORD has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth.
verses.comment: Emphasizes Israel’s special status as God’s chosen people.

verses.text: You shall not eat any abomination.
verses.comment: ‘Abomination’ refers to foods declared ritually unclean.

verses.text: These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, the goat,
verses.comment: Begins list of clean animals per Leviticus 11.

verses.text: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
verses.comment: Lists wild animals acceptable for food.

verses.text: And every animal that has a divided hoof and chews the cud, you may eat.
verses.comment: Basic requirement for land animals to be clean.

verses.text: Nevertheless, among those that chew the cud or have the divided hoof, you shall not eat these: the camel, the hare, and the rock hyrax; for they chew the cud but do not have a divided hoof. They are unclean for you.
verses.comment: Details why certain animals are excluded.

verses.text: And the pig, because it has a divided hoof but does not chew the cud, is unclean for you. You shall not eat their flesh or touch their dead carcasses.
verses.comment: Pig is unclean due to not chewing the cud.

verses.text: Of all that are in the waters, you may eat these: whatever has fins and scales you may eat.
verses.comment: Criteria for clean aquatic animals.

verses.text: But whatever does not have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean for you.
verses.comment: Excludes shellfish and similar creatures.

verses.text: You may eat all clean birds.
verses.comment: General permission for clean birds.

verses.text: But these are the ones you shall not eat: the eagle, the vulture, the buzzard,
verses.comment: Begins list of unclean birds.

verses.text: the red kite, the black kite, and any kind of falcon,
verses.comment: Names birds of prey forbidden as food.

verses.text: every kind of raven,
verses.comment: Includes all species of raven.

verses.text: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and any kind of hawk,
verses.comment: Names more forbidden birds.

verses.text: the little owl, the great owl, the barn owl,
verses.comment: Includes different types of owls.

verses.text: the pelican, the Egyptian vulture, and the cormorant,
verses.comment: Continues listing unclean birds.

verses.text: the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.
verses.comment: Concludes list of forbidden birds; bats included as flying creatures.

verses.text: And every winged insect is unclean for you; they shall not be eaten.
verses.comment: General ban on eating winged insects.

verses.text: But all clean winged creatures you may eat.
verses.comment: Allows specifically defined clean insects per Leviticus (e.g., certain locusts).

verses.text: You shall not eat anything that dies of itself. You may give it to the foreigner who is within your gates, that he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a holy people to the LORD your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.
verses.comment: Israelites forbidden to eat animals that died naturally; the boiling command repeats earlier prohibitions.

verses.text: You shall surely tithe all the produce of your seed, which comes forth year by year from your field.
verses.comment: Mandates annual agricultural tithe.

verses.text: And you shall eat before the LORD your God, in the place that he will choose, the tithe of your grain, your new wine, your oil, and the firstborn of your herd and flock, so that you may learn to fear the LORD your God always.
verses.comment: Tithe to be consumed before God at central sanctuary.

verses.text: But if the way is too long for you, so that you are not able to carry your tithe, because the place where the LORD your God chooses to put his name is too far from you, when the LORD your God blesses you,
verses.comment: Provides allowance for long travel distances.

verses.text: then you shall exchange it for money, and take the money in your hand, and go to the place that the LORD your God will choose.
verses.comment: Allows conversion of tithe produce into money for ease of transport.

verses.text: And you shall spend the money for whatever you desire: for oxen or sheep, wine or strong drink, whatever your appetite craves. And you shall eat there before the LORD your God and rejoice, you and your household.
verses.comment: Includes both food and drink in celebration, per original wording.

verses.text: And you shall not neglect the Levite who is within your gates, for he has no portion or inheritance with you.
verses.comment: Levites depended on Israel’s generosity because they had no land inheritance.

verses.text: At the end of every third year, you shall bring out all the tithe of your produce of that year and store it within your towns.
verses.comment: Institutes special tithe every third year for the needy.

verses.text: So that the Levite (because he has no portion or inheritance with you), the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow who are within your towns may come and eat and be satisfied, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands that you do.
verses.comment: Emphasizes care for disadvantaged groups and the resulting blessing from God.
